channel.title: Cookies IRC Client 0.2
channel.description:
[b]Cookies IRC Client v0.2[/b]
Basically, if you didn't already know [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,423758.0.html]I wrote an irc client ages ago[/url]. After realising how shit it was, I decided to completely re-write it. Progress went well but like everything I program I got bored and stopped so it's still generally shit, but it's an improvement from last time :) Since it's just sitting there doing nothing I thought I might as well share it with the world!
Features and shit:
[ul][li]Parses most of the IRC protocol (i've probably just missed out a couple of error codes)[/li] [li]Multiple network list (unlike my previous attempt) with the config saved to xml[/li] [li]Most basic commands which are called by typing "/" at the start of the line. eg join,part,me,msg,notice,op,ban,topic,mode,away,nick[/li] [li]Join channel/Change nick boxes for convience[/li] [li]Channel List grabber[/li] [li]Font chooser[/li] [li]Raw Log[/li] [li]Userlist popup menu (whois/private message/ban etc)[/li] [li]System tray which notifies when one has been highlighted and when a topic has been changed[/li][/ul]
Screenies:
General chat view: [img]http://imgur.com/aEK55.png[/img]
User list popup menu: [img]http://imgur.com/nE0hD.png[/img]
Editing a network: [img]http://imgur.com/eHl2d.png[/img]
Channel List: [img]http://imgur.com/vmDAK.png[/img]
Download:
[url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=462187.0;attach=18724]Entire netbeans project (source,classes,jar)[/url] [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=462187.0;attach=18723]Jar[/url]
I didn't write JCloseTabbedPane, SortedModelList and JFontChooser. I only modified these classes!

item.title: Cookies IRC Client 0.2
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

now write it in a real language

Read full topic

item.title: Cookies IRC Client 0.2
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I haven’t looked at the code, but it looks and sounds really good. Did you do the low-level IRC stuff yourself? Or did you use a library?

I did all the parsing and output myself. The only things I didn’t write are the font chooser, the sorted list model and the closing tabbed pane.

Trust me when you look at the code it wont look as good as it sounds.
I could improve it quite a lot but I am overshadowed with pure laziness. A lot of the output is hardcoded when I should really store it on file and let the user edit it.

Read full topic

item.title: Cookies IRC Client 0.2

item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Cookies IRC Client v0.2

Basically, if you didn’t already know I wrote an irc client ages ago. After realising how shit it was, I decided to completely re-write it. Progress went well but like everything I program I got bored and stopped so it’s still generally shit, but it’s an improvement from last time Since it’s just sitting there doing nothing I thought I might as well share it with the world!

Features and shit:

[ul][li]Parses most of the IRC protocol (i’ve probably just missed out a couple of error codes)[/li]
[li]Multiple network list (unlike my previous attempt) with the config saved to xml[/li]
[li]Most basic commands which are called by typing “/” at the start of the line. eg join,part,me,msg,notice,op,ban,topic,mode,away,nick[/li]
[li]Join channel/Change nick boxes for convience[/li]
[li]Channel List grabber[/li]
[li]Font chooser[/li]
[li]Raw Log[/li]
[li]Userlist popup menu (whois/private message/ban etc)[/li]
[li]System tray which notifies when one has been highlighted and when a topic has been changed[/li][/ul]
